Body: Isabel had sixteen bottles of water. After a week she had seven left.
Question: How many did she drink?

Body: Mrs. Smith gave 53 strawberries to 8 girls equally.
Question: How many strawberries did each girl get?

Body: There was 1,050 ml of tea in a pot. Anna poured the tea into some cups. If there were 65 ml of tea in each cup,
Question: how many cups were filled with tea?

Body: Tom had $19 and he wanted to buy as many folders as he could. If one folder costs $2,
Question: how many folders can Tom buy?

Body: A bee has 6 legs.
Question: How many legs do 8 bees have?

Body: Tom read three chapters of a book. If each chapter was eight pages,
Question: how many pages did he read?

Body: Mrs. Hilt bought 6 hot dogs. Each hot dog cost 50 cents.
Question: How much money did she pay for all of the hot dogs?

Body: It takes 7 minutes to bake one pan of cookies.
Question: How long will it take to bake 4 pans of cookies?

Body: The Hawks scored three touchdowns worth 7 points each.
Question: How many points do they have?

Body: For the fifth grade play, the chairs have been put into 27 rows with 16 chairs in each row.
Question: How many chairs have been put out for the play?

Body: Kim has 4 cousins. She wants to give each one 5 pieces of gum.
Question: How much gum will she need?

Body: Mrs. Hilt uses 2 ounces of detergent to wash a pound of clothes.
Question: How many ounces of soap will she use to wash 9 pounds of clothes?

Body: 5 boats are in the lake. Each boat has 3 people.
Question: How many people are on boats in the lake?

Body: Janet was practicing for a marathon. She practiced for 9 days, running 8 miles each day.
Question: How many miles did Janet run altogether?

Body: Andrew is having his friends over for game night. So he decided to prepare the snacks and the games. He started by making mini sandwiches. If he has 4 friends coming over and he made 3 sandwiches for each one of them,
Question: how many sandwiches did he make in total?

Body: There were 150 book shelves. Each book shelf had 15 books.
Question: How many books were on the shelves?

Body: He also made some juice from fresh oranges. If he used 2 oranges per glass of juice and he made 6 glasses of juice,
Question: how many oranges did he use?

Body: Robin has 27 packages of gum. There are 18 pieces in each package.
Question: How many pieces of gum does Robin have?

Body: Lastly, Andrew tried to compute his expenses for the game night. If he spent $9.00 for each game they played and they played a total of 5 games,
Question: how much money did he spend that night?

Body: Mike played six games of basketball with his friends. If Mike scored four points each game,
Question: how many points did he score total?

Body: Her mom also baked some cookies. If she baked 5 pans of cookies and there are 8 cookies per pan,
Question: how many cookies did her mom bake for her birthday?

Body: Olivia's dad took her and some friends out to eat for her birthday. If each meal costs 7 dollars and her dad paid for 3 meals,
Question: how much did he spend?

Body: They planned to serve some cold drinks as well. If they plan to make 9 pitchers of drinks and each pitcher can fill 6 glasses,
Question: how many glasses of drinks are they planning to prepare in total?

Body: Having this kind of collection made Jack a fast reader. If he can read 9 books in a day,
Question: how many books can he read in a year (a year = 365 days)?

Body: They decided to hold the party in their backyard. If they have 8 sets of tables and each set has 7 chairs,
Question: how many chairs do they have for the guests?

Body: There are 261 fishbowls. Each fishbowl has 23 fish.
Question: How many fish are there?

Body: At the end of the party, Mona gave away some souvenirs to her 6 closest friends. If each of them received 2 souvenir items,
Question: how many souvenirs did Mona give away?

Body: Your class is having a pizza party. You buy 5 pizzas. Each pizza has 4 slices.
Question: How many slices is that altogether?

Body: John is building a tree house to serve as his hideout whenever he wanted to spend some time alone with himself. The first thing he did is to gather some materials. For the pillars, he needs two sets of wood with different lengths. If the first set of wood is 4 feet long and the second set is 5 times longer than the first set,
Question: how long is the second set of wood?

Body: The Razorback T-shirt Shop makes $9 dollars off each t-shirt sold. During the Arkansas and Texas Tech game they sold 245 t-shirts.
Question: How much money did they make from selling the t-shirts?

Body: Another material that he needs is rope. If he already has 6 feet of rope and he needs additional ropes having 5 times the length of what he already have,
Question: how long should be the additional rope?

Body: There are 124 students making 3 stars each for the school wall.
Question: How many stars will they make all together?

Body: For the walls of the house, he would use 9 large planks of wood. If each plank of wood needs 8 pieces of nails to be secured,
Question: how many nails does John need for the house wall?

Body: Each bag contains 23 pounds of oranges.
Question: How many pounds of oranges are in 45 bags?

Body: Dave earned $53.90. Sara earned $39.33.
Question: How much more money did Dave earn than Sara?

Body: A waiter had nineteen customers. After some left he still had four customers.
Question: What's the difference between the number of customers before leaving and after leaving?

Body: Greg and Brad started reading their books at the same time. Greg read 18 pages a day. Brad read 26 pages a day.
Question: How many more pages did Brad read than Greg?

Body: Paul spent $75. Now he has $11.
Question: What's the difference between the number of dollars that he spent and he has now?

Body: Rick and Todd have the same number of candy bars. Rick ate 11 candy bars. Todd gave away 18 of his candy bars.
Question: How many more candy bars did Rick have than Todd then?

Body: A museum had fourteen paintings. After they got rid of some, they had four left.
Question: What's the difference between the number of paintings before they got rid of and the left?

Body: Annette and Caitlin weigh 95 pounds together. Caitlin and Sara weigh 87 pounds together.
Question: How much more does Annette weigh than Sara?

Body: Haley had 2 dollars. If she got 13 more dollars in total for doing chores and her birthday,
Question: what's the difference between the number of dollars before Haley got money and she got from events?

Body: Trevor counted 77 coins in his bank. He counted 29 quarters. The rest are dimes.
Question: How many more coints of the total than quarts does Trevor have?
